intro: Mesembryanthemum paulum, commonly known as the Cape groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which are often yellow or orange, bloom in the morning and close by midday. Mesembryanthemum paulum is also known for its ability to thrive in full sun and its use in ornamental gardening.
